extensionDescription.message: Add quotation marks around text blocks in editor fields: Select the lines you want to quote and press the toolbar button.

infoUsage.message:
Usage

  • Set the focus (text cursor) in a multiline text field (<textarea>) of any web page)
  • Select the lines you want to quote. If you only want to quote a single line, you don't need to mark any text, just set the cursor to any position within this line. In case you want to mark several lines, just select (highlight) the text range. The start and end of the selection can be on any position within the first and last line - no need te select full lines.
  • Now press [Ctrl]+[E] or click the QuoteMe icon in the toolbar.

infoQuoteDrawback.message:
Drawback

Firefox 55 changed the behavior of the <textarea>: It now nukes the undo buffer if there are any text changes through JavaScript. The Bug was finally resolved in Firefox 89. This means that in Firefox from Version 55 up to 88, after adding quotes through the QuoteMe add-on, you can not undo any previous changes, not even remove the quotes through [Ctrl]+[Z]. Firefox 89 and newer releases work as expected.

infoQuoteSet.message: The default version is the predefined short ASCII set; long ASCII adds more dashes. The Unicode sets use combinations of Box-drawing characters while E-Mail adds > to the text block and a literal Quote at the start.

infoQuoteStart.message: This full line is inserted right before the to-be quoted text.

infoQuoteBlock.message: These characters are added to each line of the to-be quoted text.

infoQuoteStopp.message: This full line inserted right after the to-be quoted text.

infoQuoteClean.message: Clean trailing whitespace characters in each quoted line.

infoQuoteSave.message: Please note that any changes to the configuration only takes effect if you press the 'Save' button.
